H0.text: French for an additive, and a Venezuelan liberator of Ecuador, Bolivia and Peru from Spain, what was the currency of Ecuador before adopting the US dollar in the early 2000s. Peso

H1.text: French for an additive, and a Venezuelan liberator of Ecuador, Bolivia and Peru from Spain, what was the currency of Ecuador before adopting the US dollar in the early 2000s. Real

H2.text: French for an additive, and a Venezuelan liberator of Ecuador, Bolivia and Peru from Spain, what was the currency of Ecuador before adopting the US dollar in the early 2000s. Sol

H3.text: French for an additive, and a Venezuelan liberator of Ecuador, Bolivia and Peru from Spain, what was the currency of Ecuador before adopting the US dollar in the early 2000s. Sucer

A4.text: The peso served as Ecuador's currency until 1884.

A5.text: In 1884, the peso was replaced by the sucre at par.

A6.text: On March 9, 2000, President Gustavo Noboa signed a law adopting the US dollar as legal tender in Ecuador, replacing the sucre.

A7.text: Ecuador's monetary law permitted the import of 5-franc pieces of France, Italy, Belgium, Switzerland; of the pesos of Chile and Colombia; of the Peruvian sol; and of the United States dollar and its fractions.
